page.title: 05Pubs in Langford
page.content: There are three public houses in the area. Most of the customers come from outside the area. They are picturesque country pubs one of which dates back to the fourteenth century. One of the pubs in Langford is called The Crown. It is run by a landlady who does not employ anyone else.(Except on a part-time basis).It is open everyday during the normal licensing hours. The landlady works sixteen and a half hours a day.They serve meals and have a diningroom. The most popular dishes are lasagne, spaghetti, and curry and rice. There are between forty and one hundred and forty customers each day.In the first six months of 1985 they sold sixty barrels of beer and two hundred and forty bottles of wines and spirits. The beer is kept in metal kegs and is stored in the cellar and outside bottle store.
